edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.util
Class SDARTSHandlerBase

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--org.xml.sax.HandlerBase
        |
        +--edu.columbia.cs.sdarts.util.SDARTSHandlerBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.xml.sax.DocumentHandler, org.xml.sax.DTDHandler, org.xml.sax.EntityResolver, org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
STARTSIntermediateHandler
public abstract class SDARTSHandlerBase
extends org.xml.sax.HandlerBase

A subclass of the standard SAX HandlerBase that provides extra functionality. It has the following extra features:

  • Helper methods for removing the namespace declarations from elements and attributes - this is helpful in post-processing output from the SDLIP HTTP/DASL layer
  • Built-in SAX parser - just call getParser() to access it
  • Built-in error handling functions that make use of the org.xml.sax.Locator object.
  • Making all org.xml.sax.DocumentHandler methods abstract again, to force developers to pay attention to them

Both the main SAX site and the Sun JAXP site have information on SAX, the major framework used by SDARTS to parse XML.

getNamespace

public java.lang.String getNamespace(java.lang.String name)
Tells what the namespace of qualified XML element name is.
Parameters:

Returns:

removeNamespace

public java.lang.String removeNamespace(java.lang.String name)
Returns a qualified XML element's name, shorn of its namespace
Parameters:
name - the element
Returns:
the universal name for the element, or the same name if it didn't have a namespace qualifier

removeNamespace

public org.xml.sax.AttributeList removeNamespace(org.xml.sax.AttributeList attrs)
Goes through a SAX AttributeList, removes the namespace name from each qualified attribute, and returns a new AttributeList. It does not modify the incoming list.
Parameters:
attrs - a SAX AttributeList
Returns:
a new list whose names do not have namespace qualifiers

processException

protected void processException(java.lang.String msg)
                         throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Creates a SAXException with the incoming message, and also makes use of the SAX Locator in the exception
Parameters:
msg - the message for the exception
Throws:
automatically - throws a new SAXException with the message. If the Locator is set, it sends a SAXParseException using the Locator

processException

protected void processException(java.lang.String msg,
                                org.xml.sax.SAXException e)
                         throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Creates a SAXException with the incoming message, and also makes use of the SAX Locator in the exception
Parameters:
msg - the message for the exception
e - the exception to nest inside this new exception
Throws:
automatically - throws a new SAXException with the message. If the Locator is set, it sends a SAXParseException using the Locator
